name: TV Characters Played by Two (or More) Actors Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Name the TV character whose parents were played by three different pairs of actors, most notably (and last) Carol Burnett and Carroll O'Connor.
questions.explanation:
Jamie Buchman.

	From 'Mad About You'. Jamie's mom, Theresa Stemple, was played by Nancy Dussault, Penny Fuller, and Carol Burnett. Her dad, Gus Stemple, was played by Paul Dooley, John Karlen, and Carroll O'Connor.

questions.text: One of two actresses who played Fallon Colby on 'Dynasty'.
questions.explanation:
Pamela Sue Martin & Emma Samms.

	The character Steven Daniel Carrington was also played by two actors: Al Corley and Jack Coleman.

questions.text: This 'Gilligan's Island' actress refused to reprise her role in the several reunion TV movies.
questions.explanation:
Tina Louise.

	Two other actresses have played Ginger Grant in the TV movies.

questions.text: One of two actors who played Dr. Zee, the child prodigy, on 'Galactica 1980' (the following series of 'Battlestar Galactica').
questions.explanation:
Robbie Rist & James Patrick Stuart.

	Robbie Rist is fondly remembered at Oliver, the Brady Bunch's young cousin. James Patrick Stuart is the son of Chad Stuart, of the 1960's group Chad and Jeremy.

questions.text: On 'Bewitched', Samantha Stephens's husband Darrin was played by two actors who both had this first name.
questions.explanation:
dick.

	Dick York and Dick Sargent. Wayne Campbell (Wayne's World): 'Dick York and Dick Sargeant. Yeah, right, as if we wouldn't notice! Oh hold on: Dick York, Dick Sergeant, Sergeant York... Wow, thats weird!'

questions.text: This British science fiction show had more than 7 different actors play the main character over its long run, which began airing first in 1963.
questions.explanation:
Doctor Who.

	The writers came up with the plot device that whenever The Doctor had a mortal injury, he could regenerate. This regeneration also altered his appearance and personality, allowing for a new actor to play him. The original 26 seasons aired from 1963-1989, and was renewed for another run that began in 2005.

questions.text: This child on 'Roseanne' was played by two actors who swapped back and forth three times.
questions.explanation:
Becky.

	Played by Alicia 'Lecy' Goranson 1988-1992 and 1995-1996 and by Sarah Chalke 1993-1995 and 1996-1997.

questions.text: This character role was shared by twin sister actresses throughout the run of its series.
options: ADA Catherine Chandler, 'Beauty and the Beast'
questions.explanation:
Michelle Tanner, 'Full House'.

	Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen played Michelle Tanner from the time they were 6 months old. (Twin babies are often used for roles so that the better-tempered child at any given time can be used on-screen.) With the success of the series 'Full House', they continued to share the role. In their subsequent roles, however, they've chosen to play twin sisters.FYI: Linda Hamilton (Catherine Chandler, 'Beauty and the Beast') has a twin Leslie who played a duplicate Sarah Connor in 'Terminator 2', but didn't work in 'BatB'. Kelsey and Kirsten Dohring played baby Chrissy Seaver, but were replaced by the single actress Ashley Johnson.Alexandra Paul, actress and triathelete, has a twin Caroline who is a San Francisco firefighter and Pulitzer-nominated author.

questions.text: 'As The World Turns': This character has been played by 13 different characters.
questions.explanation:
Tommy Hughes.

	Played by (in order): James Madden, Jerry Schaffer, Frankie Michaels, Richard Thomas (aka John-Boy Walton), Paul O'Keefe, Peter Link, Peter Galman, David Colson, Tom Tammi, Justin Deas, Jason Kincaid, Gregg Marx, and Scott Holmes.

questions.text: 'The Waltons': The character John-Boy Walton left the show in 1977, then returned in 1979, played by a new actor (replacing Richard Thomas). He was:
